ThingDef.label: Grookey
ThingDef.description: It attacks with rapid beats of its stick. As it strikes with amazing speed, it gets more and more pumped.\nWhen it uses its special stick to strike up a beat, the sound waves produced carry revitalizing energy to the plants and flowers in the area.

ThingDef.label: Thwackey
ThingDef.description: When it’s drumming out rapid beats in battle, it gets so caught up in the rhythm that it won’t even notice that it’s already knocked out its opponent.\nThe faster a Thwackey can beat out a rhythm with its two sticks, the more respect it wins from its peers.

ThingDef.label: Rillaboom
ThingDef.description: The one with the best drumming techniques becomes the boss of the troop. It has a gentle disposition and values harmony among its group.\nBy drumming, it taps into the power of its special tree stump. The roots of the stump follow its direction in battle.

ThingDef.label: Scorbunny
ThingDef.description: It has special pads on the backs of its feet, and one on its nose. Once it’s raring to fight, these pads radiate tremendous heat.\nA warm-up of running around gets fire energy coursing through this Pokémon’s body. Once that happens, it’s ready to fight at full power.

ThingDef.label: Raboot
ThingDef.description: It kicks berries right off the branches of trees and then juggles them with its feet, practicing its footwork.\nIts thick and fluffy fur protects it from the cold and enables it to use hotter fire moves.

ThingDef.label: Cinderace
ThingDef.description: It’s skilled at both offense and defense, and it gets pumped up when cheered on. But if it starts showboating, it could put itself in a tough spot.\nIt juggles a pebble with its feet, turning it into a burning soccer ball. Its shots strike opponents hard and leave them scorched.

ThingDef.label: Sobble
ThingDef.description: When it gets wet, its skin changes color, and this Pokémon becomes invisible as if it were camouflaged.\nWhen scared, this Pokémon cries. Its tears pack the chemical punch of 100 onions, and attackers won’t be able to resist weeping.

ThingDef.label: Drizzile
ThingDef.description: Highly intelligent but also very lazy, it keeps enemies out of its territory by laying traps everywhere.\nA clever combatant, this Pokémon battles using water balloons created with moisture secreted from its palms.

ThingDef.label: Inteleon
ThingDef.description: Its nictitating membranes let it pick out foes’ weak points so it can precisely blast them with water that shoots from its fingertips at Mach 3.\nIt has many hidden capabilities, such as fingertips that can shoot water and a membrane on its back that it can use to glide through the air.

ThingDef.label: Skwovet
ThingDef.description: It eats berries nonstop—a habit that has made it more resilient than it looks. It’ll show up on farms, searching for yet more berries.\nFound throughout the Galar region, this Pokémon becomes uneasy if its cheeks are ever completely empty of berries.

ThingDef.label: Greedent
ThingDef.description: Common throughout the Galar region, this Pokémon has strong teeth and can chew through the toughest of berry shells.\nIt stashes berries in its tail—so many berries that they fall out constantly. But this Pokémon is a bit slow-witted, so it doesn’t notice the loss.

ThingDef.label: Rookidee
ThingDef.description: Jumping nimbly about, this small-bodied Pokémon takes advantage of even the slightest opportunity to disorient larger opponents.\nIt will bravely challenge any opponent, no matter how powerful. This Pokémon benefits from every battle—even a defeat increases its strength a bit.

ThingDef.label: Corvisquire
ThingDef.description: The lessons of many harsh battles have taught it how to accurately judge an opponent’s strength.\nSmart enough to use tools in battle, these Pokémon have been seen picking up rocks and flinging them or using ropes to wrap up enemies.

ThingDef.label: Corviknight
ThingDef.description: With their great intellect and flying skills, these Pokémon very successfully act as the Galar region’s airborne taxi service.\nThis Pokémon reigns supreme in the skies of the Galar region. The black luster of its steel body could drive terror into the heart of any foe.

ThingDef.label: Blipbug
ThingDef.description: Often found in gardens, this Pokémon has hairs on its body that it uses to assess its surroundings.\nA constant collector of information, this Pokémon is very smart. Very strong is what it isn’t.

ThingDef.label: Dottler
ThingDef.description: As it grows inside its shell, it uses its psychic abilities to monitor the outside world and prepare for evolution.\nIt barely moves, but it’s still alive. Hiding in its shell without food or water seems to have awakened its psychic powers.

ThingDef.label: Orbeetle
ThingDef.description: It emits psychic energy to observe and study what’s around it—and what’s around it can include things over six miles away.\nIt’s famous for its high level of intelligence, and the large size of its brain is proof that it also possesses immense psychic power.

ThingDef.label: Nickit
ThingDef.description: Cunning and cautious, this Pokémon survives by stealing food from others. It erases its tracks with swipes of its tail as it makes off with its plunder.\nAided by the soft pads on its feet, it silently raids the food stores of other Pokémon. It survives off its ill-gotten gains.

ThingDef.label: Thievul
ThingDef.description: With a lithe body and sharp claws, it goes around stealing food and eggs. Boltund is its natural enemy.\nIt secretly marks potential targets with a scent. By following the scent, it stalks its targets and steals from them when they least expect it.

ThingDef.label: Gossifleur
ThingDef.description: It whirls around in the wind while singing a joyous song. This delightful display has charmed many into raising this Pokémon.\nIt anchors itself in the ground with its single leg, then basks in the sun. After absorbing enough sunlight, its petals spread as it blooms brilliantly.

ThingDef.label: Eldegoss
ThingDef.description: The cotton on the head of this Pokémon can be spun into a glossy, gorgeous yarn—a Galar regional specialty.\nThe seeds attached to its cotton fluff are full of nutrients. It spreads them on the wind so that plants and other Pokémon can benefit from them.

ThingDef.label: Wooloo
ThingDef.description: If its fleece grows too long, Wooloo won’t be able to move. Cloth made with the wool of this Pokémon is surprisingly strong.\nIts curly fleece is such an effective cushion that this Pokémon could fall off a cliff and stand right back up at the bottom, unharmed.

ThingDef.label: Dubwool
ThingDef.description: Its majestic horns are meant only to impress the opposite gender. They never see use in battle.\nWeave a carpet from its springy wool, and you end up with something closer to a trampoline. You’ll start to bounce the moment you set foot on it.

ThingDef.label: Chewtle
ThingDef.description: It starts off battles by attacking with its rock-hard horn, but as soon as the opponent flinches, this Pokémon bites down and never lets go.\nApparently the itch of its teething impels it to snap its jaws at anything in front of it.

ThingDef.label: Drednaw
ThingDef.description: This Pokémon rapidly extends its retractable neck to sink its sharp fangs into distant enemies and take them down.\nWith jaws that can shear through steel rods, this highly aggressive Pokémon chomps down on its unfortunate prey.

ThingDef.label: Yamper
ThingDef.description: This gluttonous Pokémon only assists people with their work because it wants treats. As it runs, it crackles with electricity.\nThis Pokémon is very popular as a herding dog in the Galar region. As it runs, it generates electricity from the base of its tail.

ThingDef.label: Boltund
ThingDef.description: It sends electricity through its legs to boost their strength. Running at top speed, it easily breaks 50 mph.\nThis Pokémon generates electricity and channels it into its legs to keep them going strong. Boltund can run nonstop for three full days.

ThingDef.label: Rolycoly
ThingDef.description: It can race around like a unicycle, even on rough, rocky terrain. Burning coal sustains it.\nMost of its body has the same composition as coal. Fittingly, this Pokémon was first discovered in coal mines about 400 years ago.

ThingDef.label: Carkol
ThingDef.description: By rapidly rolling its legs, it can travel at over 18 mph. The temperature of the flames it breathes exceeds 1,800 degrees Fahrenheit.\nIt forms coal inside its body. Coal dropped by this Pokémon once helped fuel the lives of people in the Galar region.

ThingDef.label: Coalossal
ThingDef.description: While it’s engaged in battle, its mountain of coal will burn bright red, sending off sparks that scorch the surrounding area.\nIt’s usually peaceful, but the vandalism of mines enrages it. Offenders will be incinerated with flames that reach 2,700 degrees Fahrenheit.

ThingDef.label: Applin
ThingDef.description: As soon as it’s born, it burrows into an apple. Not only does the apple serve as its food source, but the flavor of the fruit determines its evolution.\nIt spends its entire life inside an apple. It hides from its natural enemies, bird Pokémon, by pretending it’s just an apple and nothing more.

ThingDef.label: Flapple
ThingDef.description: It flies on wings of apple skin and spits a powerful acid. It can also change its shape into that of an apple.\nIt ate a sour apple, and that induced its evolution. In its cheeks, it stores an acid capable of causing chemical burns.

ThingDef.label: Appletun
ThingDef.description: Its body is covered in sweet nectar, and the skin on its back is especially yummy. Children used to have it as a snack.\nEating a sweet apple caused its evolution. A nectarous scent wafts from its body, luring in the bug Pokémon it preys on.

ThingDef.label: Silicobra
ThingDef.description: It spews sand from its nostrils. While the enemy is blinded, it burrows into the ground to hide.\nAs it digs, it swallows sand and stores it in its neck pouch. The pouch can hold more than 17 pounds of sand.

ThingDef.label: Sandaconda
ThingDef.description: Its unique style of coiling allows it to blast sand out of its sand sac more efficiently.\nWhen it contracts its body, over 220 pounds of sand sprays from its nose. If it ever runs out of sand, it becomes disheartened.

ThingDef.label: Cramorant
ThingDef.description: This hungry Pokémon swallows Arrokuda whole. Occasionally, it makes a mistake and tries to swallow a Pokémon other than its preferred prey.\nIt’s so strong that it can knock out some opponents in a single hit, but it also may forget what it’s battling midfight.

ThingDef.label: Arrokuda
ThingDef.description: After it’s eaten its fill, its movements become extremely sluggish. That’s when Cramorant swallows it up.\nIf it sees any movement around it, this Pokémon charges for it straightaway, leading with its sharply pointed jaw. It’s very proud of that jaw.

ThingDef.label: Barraskewda
ThingDef.description: It spins its tail fins to propel itself, surging forward at speeds of over 100 knots before ramming prey and spearing into them.\nThis Pokémon has a jaw that’s as sharp as a spear and as strong as steel. Apparently Barraskewda’s flesh is surprisingly tasty, too.

ThingDef.label: Toxel
ThingDef.description: It manipulates the chemical makeup of its poison to produce electricity. The voltage is weak, but it can cause a tingling paralysis.\nIt stores poison in an internal poison sac and secretes that poison through its skin. If you touch this Pokémon, a tingling sensation follows.

ThingDef.label: Toxtricity
ThingDef.description: It has an electrical organ on its chest. While generating electricity, it fills its surroundings with what sounds like the strumming of a bass guitar.\nCapable of generating 15,000 volts of electricity, this Pokémon looks down on all that would challenge it.

ThingDef.label: Sizzlipede
ThingDef.description: It wraps prey up with its heated body, cooking them in its coils. Once they’re well-done, it will voraciously nibble them down to the last morsel.\nIt stores flammable gas in its body and uses it to generate heat. The yellow sections on its belly get particularly hot.

ThingDef.label: Centiskorch
ThingDef.description: While its burning body is already dangerous on its own, this excessively hostile Pokémon also has large and very sharp fangs.\nWhen it heats up, its body temperature reaches about 1,500 degrees Fahrenheit. It lashes its body like a whip and launches itself at enemies.

ThingDef.label: Clobbopus
ThingDef.description: Its tentacles tear off easily, but it isn’t alarmed when that happens—it knows they’ll grow back. It’s about as smart as a three-year-old.\nIt’s very curious, but its means of investigating things is to try to punch them with its tentacles. The search for food is what brings it onto land.

ThingDef.label: Grapploct
ThingDef.description: Searching for an opponent to test its skills against, it emerges onto land. Once the battle is over, it returns to the sea.\nA body made up of nothing but muscle makes the grappling moves this Pokémon performs with its tentacles tremendously powerful.

ThingDef.label: Sinistea
ThingDef.description: The teacup in which this Pokémon makes its home is a famous piece of antique tableware. Many forgeries are in circulation.\nThis Pokémon is said to have been born when a lonely spirit possessed a cold, leftover cup of tea.

ThingDef.label: Polteageist
ThingDef.description: Leaving leftover black tea unattended is asking for this Pokémon to come along and pour itself into it, turning the tea into a new Polteageist.\nThis species lives in antique teapots. Most pots are forgeries, but on rare occasions, an authentic work is found.

ThingDef.label: Hatenna
ThingDef.description: If this Pokémon senses a strong emotion, it will run away as fast as it can. It prefers areas without people.\nVia the protrusion on its head, it senses other creatures’ emotions. If you don’t have a calm disposition, it will never warm up to you.

ThingDef.label: Hattrem
ThingDef.description: Using the braids on its head, it pummels foes to get them to quiet down. One blow from those braids would knock out a professional boxer.\nNo matter who you are, if you bring strong emotions near this Pokémon, it will silence you violently.

ThingDef.label: Hatterene
ThingDef.description: If you’re too loud around it, you risk being torn apart by the claws on its tentacle. This Pokémon is also known as the Forest Witch.\nIt emits psychic power strong enough to cause headaches as a deterrent to the approach of others.

ThingDef.label: Impidimp
ThingDef.description: It sneaks into people’s homes, stealing things and feasting on the negative energy of the frustrated occupants.\nThrough its nose, it sucks in the emanations produced by people and Pokémon when they feel annoyed. It thrives off this negative energy.

ThingDef.label: Morgrem
ThingDef.description: With sly cunning, it tries to lure people into the woods. Some believe it to have the power to make crops grow.\nWhen it gets down on all fours as if to beg for forgiveness, it’s trying to lure opponents in so that it can stab them with its spear-like hair.

ThingDef.label: Grimmsnarl
ThingDef.description: Its hairs work like muscle fibers. When its hairs unfurl, they latch on to opponents, ensnaring them as tentacles would.\nWith the hair wrapped around its body helping to enhance its muscles, this Pokémon can overwhelm even Machamp.

ThingDef.label: Obstagoon
ThingDef.description: It evolved after experiencing numerous fights. While crossing its arms, it lets out a shout that would make any opponent flinch.\nIts voice is staggering in volume. Obstagoon has a tendency to take on a threatening posture and shout—this move is known as Obstruct.

ThingDef.label: Perrserker
ThingDef.description: After many battles, it evolved dangerous claws that come together to form daggers when extended.\nWhat appears to be an iron helmet is actually hardened hair. This Pokémon lives for the thrill of battle.

ThingDef.label: Cursola
ThingDef.description: Be cautious of the ectoplasmic body surrounding its soul. You’ll become stiff as stone if you touch it.\nIts shell is overflowing with its heightened otherworldly energy. The ectoplasm serves as protection for this Pokémon’s core spirit.

ThingDef.label: Sirfetch'd
ThingDef.description: After deflecting attacks with its hard leaf shield, it strikes back with its sharp leek stalk. The leek stalk is both weapon and food.\nOnly Farfetch’d that have survived many battles can attain this evolution. When this Pokémon’s leek withers, it will retire from combat.

ThingDef.label: Mr. Rime
ThingDef.description: Its amusing movements make it very popular. It releases its psychic power from the pattern on its belly.\nIt’s highly skilled at tap-dancing. It waves its cane of ice in time with its graceful movements.

ThingDef.label: Runerigus
ThingDef.description: Never touch its shadowlike body, or you’ll be shown the horrific memories behind the picture carved into it.\nA powerful curse was woven into an ancient painting. After absorbing the spirit of a Yamask, the painting began to move.

ThingDef.label: Milcery
ThingDef.description: They say that any patisserie visited by Milcery is guaranteed success and good fortune.\nThis Pokémon was born from sweet-smelling particles in the air. Its body is made of cream.

ThingDef.label: Alcremie
ThingDef.description: When Alcremie is content, the cream it secretes from its hands becomes sweeter and richer.\nWhen it trusts a Trainer, it will treat them to berries it's decorated with cream.

ThingDef.label: Falinks
ThingDef.description: The six of them work together as one Pokémon. Teamwork is also their battle strategy, and they constantly change their formation as they fight.\nFive of them are troopers, and one is the brass. The brass’s orders are absolute.

ThingDef.label: Pincurchin
ThingDef.description: It stores electricity in each spine. Even if one gets broken off, it still continues to emit electricity for at least three hours.\nIt feeds on seaweed, using its teeth to scrape it off rocks. Electric current flows from the tips of its spines.

ThingDef.label: Snom
ThingDef.description: It eats snow that piles up on the ground. The more snow it eats, the bigger and more impressive the spikes on its back grow.\nIt spits out thread imbued with a frigid sort of energy and uses it to tie its body to branches, disguising itself as an icicle while it sleeps.

ThingDef.label: Frosmoth
ThingDef.description: It shows no mercy to any who desecrate fields and mountains. It will fly around on its icy wings, causing a blizzard to chase offenders away.\nIcy scales fall from its wings like snow as it flies over fields and mountains. The temperature of its wings is less than −290 degrees Fahrenheit.

ThingDef.label: Stonjourner
ThingDef.description: Once a year, on a specific date and at a specific time, they gather out of nowhere and form up in a circle.\nIt stands in grasslands, watching the sun’s descent from zenith to horizon. This Pokémon has a talent for delivering dynamic kicks.

ThingDef.label: Eiscue
ThingDef.description: This Pokémon keeps its heat-sensitive head cool with ice. It fishes for its food, dangling its single hair into the sea to lure in prey.\nIt drifted in on the flow of ocean waters from a frigid place. It keeps its head iced constantly to make sure it stays nice and cold.

ThingDef.label: Indeedee
ThingDef.description: Through its horns, it can pick up on the emotions of creatures around it. Positive emotions are the source of its strength.\nIt uses the horns on its head to sense the emotions of others. Males will act as valets for those they serve, looking after their every need.

ThingDef.label: Morpeko
ThingDef.description: It carries electrically roasted seeds with it as if they’re precious treasures. No matter how much it eats, it always gets hungry again in short order.\nAs it eats the seeds stored up in its pocket-like pouches, this Pokémon is not just satisfying its constant hunger. It’s also generating electricity.

ThingDef.label: Cufant
ThingDef.description: If a job requires serious strength, this Pokémon will excel at it. Its copper body tarnishes in the rain, turning a vibrant green color.\nIt digs up the ground with its trunk. It’s also very strong, being able to carry loads of over five tons without any problem at all.

ThingDef.label: Copperajah
ThingDef.description: These Pokémon live in herds. Their trunks have incredible grip strength, strong enough to crush giant rocks into powder.\nThey came over from another region long ago and worked together with humans. Their green skin is resistant to water.

ThingDef.label: Dracozolt
ThingDef.description: The powerful muscles in its tail generate its electricity. Compared to its lower body, its upper half is entirely too small.\nIn ancient times, it was unbeatable thanks to its powerful lower body, but it went extinct anyway after it depleted all its plant-based food sources.

ThingDef.label: Arctozolt
ThingDef.description: This Pokémon lived on prehistoric seashores and was able to preserve food with the ice on its body. It went extinct because it moved so slowly.\nThe shaking of its freezing upper half is what generates its electricity. It has a hard time walking around.

ThingDef.label: Dracovish
ThingDef.description: Its mighty legs are capable of running at speeds exceeding 40 mph, but this Pokémon can’t breathe unless it’s underwater.\nPowerful legs and jaws made it the apex predator of its time. Its own overhunting of its prey was what drove it to extinction.

ThingDef.label: Arctovish
ThingDef.description: The skin on its face is impervious to attack, but breathing difficulties made this Pokémon go extinct anyway.\nThough it’s able to capture prey by freezing its surroundings, it has trouble eating the prey afterward because its mouth is on top of its head.

ThingDef.label: Duraludon
ThingDef.description: The special metal that composes its body is very light, so this Pokémon has considerable agility. It lives in caves because it dislikes the rain.\nIts body resembles polished metal, and it’s both lightweight and strong. The only drawback is that it rusts easily.

ThingDef.label: Dreepy
ThingDef.description: If this weak Pokémon is by itself, a mere child could defeat it. But if Dreepy has friends to help it train, it can evolve and become much stronger.\nAfter being reborn as a ghost Pokémon, Dreepy wanders the areas it used to inhabit back when it was alive in prehistoric seas.

ThingDef.label: Drakloak
ThingDef.description: Without a Dreepy to place on its head and care for, it gets so uneasy it’ll try to substitute any Pokémon it finds for the missing Dreepy.\nIt’s capable of flying faster than 120 mph. It battles alongside Dreepy and dotes on them until they successfully evolve.

ThingDef.label: Dragapult
ThingDef.description: Apparently the Dreepy inside Dragapult’s horns eagerly look forward to being launched out at Mach speeds.\nWhen it isn’t battling, it keeps Dreepy in the holes on its horns. Once a fight starts, it launches the Dreepy like supersonic missiles.

ThingDef.label: Zacian
ThingDef.description: This Pokémon has slumbered for many years. Some say it’s Zamazenta’s elder sister—others say the two Pokémon are rivals.\nKnown as a legendary hero, this Pokémon absorbs metal particles, transforming them into a weapon it uses to battle.

ThingDef.label: Zamazenta
ThingDef.description: This Pokémon slept for aeons while in the form of a statue. It was asleep for so long, people forgot that it ever existed.\nIn times past, it worked together with a king of the people to save the Galar region. It absorbs metal that it then uses in battle.

ThingDef.label: Eternatus
ThingDef.description: It was inside a meteorite that fell 20,000 years ago. There seems to be a connection between this Pokémon and the Dynamax phenomenon.\nThe core on its chest absorbs energy emanating from the lands of the Galar region. This energy is what allows Eternatus to stay active.

ThingDef.label: Kubfu
ThingDef.description: If Kubfu pulls the long white hair on its head, its fighting spirit heightens and power wells up from the depths of its belly.\nKubfu trains hard to perfect its moves. The moves it masters will determine which form it takes when it evolves.

ThingDef.label: Urshifu
ThingDef.description: Inhabiting the mountains of a distant region, this Pokémon races across sheer cliffs, training its legs and refining its moves.\nThis form of Urshifu is a strong believer in the one-hit KO. Its strategy is to leap in close to foes and land a devastating blow with a hardened fist.

ThingDef.label: Zarude
ThingDef.description: Once the vines on Zarude's body tear off, they become nutrients in the soil. This helps the plants of the forest grow.\nWithin dense forests, this Pokémon lives in a pack with others of its kind. It's incredibly aggressive, and the other Pokémon of the forest fear it.

ThingDef.label: Regieleki
ThingDef.description: Its entire body is made up of a single organ that generates electrical energy. Regieleki is capable of creating all Galar’s electricity.\nThis Pokémon is a cluster of electrical energy. It’s said that removing the rings on Regieleki’s body will unleash the Pokémon’s latent power.

ThingDef.label: Regidrago
ThingDef.description: Its body is composed of crystallized dragon energy. Regidrago is said to have the powers of every dragon Pokémon.\nAn academic theory proposes that Regidrago’s arms were once the head of an ancient dragon Pokémon. The theory remains unproven.

ThingDef.label: Calyrex
ThingDef.description: Calyrex is known in legend as a king that ruled over Galar in ancient times. It has the power to cause hearts to mend and plants to spring forth.\nCalyrex is a merciful Pokémon, capable of providing healing and blessings. It reigned over the Galar region in times of yore.
